text: [Music]
so as I was strolling past some of the
booths here at Computex a couple cases
over at the rajan tech booth caught my
eye I was expecting to see maybe a new
thread Ripper CPU cooler or something
like that seeing as that has been the
trend but instead I was greeted with two
tempered glass small form-factor mini
ITX cases these other new oathean and
oathean evo now whether that's
afyon or Oh fine he's yet to be
clarified but one thing is for sure and
that's that these cases are pretty neat
and compact before that though a quick
word from MSI for making this trip
possible thinking of upgrading your
gaming monitor MSI optics MGP curved
gaming monitors compact with eight 144
hertz refresh rate 1,800 our curvature
and up to a 1440p resolution and for a
limited time include a free SteelSeries
prism RGB mousepad and steam wallet gift
card with every purchase in selected
countries see the link in the
description to upgrade your game with
MSI okay so the small case the affiant
is just 12.1 liters in volume and is
said to be released soon for just 115 US
dollars and the larger fire evo is just
15 point 9 liters in volume adds 240
millimeter radiator support and will be
released for around 1:30 both the cases
have an aluminium construction with a
brushed finish as you can see here dust
filters come included at the top for
both as well which is great to see
that's definitely important as well as
both cases support fans at the top and
Rajan Tech said that you can choose
between both a tempered glass version
and a standard perforated panel version
which I'm guessing it may be a little
bit cheaper in a market where everything
is way too big and where most companies
are essentially copying each other it's
great to see Raj and tech be bold and
move into the small form-factor market
which desperately needs attention on the
budget and the fact that both of these
cases are relatively optimized in terms
of space to what we're used to seeing
and they're both at an affordable price
range is definitely pleasing to see okay
on to the specs and compatibility now
and let's start with the 12.1 litre of
fire on the left in terms of CPU cooler
height Rajan text said that they were
using one of their 66 millimetres tall
coolers and by the looks of it
did have a few millimeters of clearance
left so the official measurement is more
like 68 or 70 both cases use the same
sandwich design that we've seen from
more expensive cases like the den a4 and
this of course requires a riser cable
and Rajan Tech confirmed that this will
be included for both the cases
another pleasing feature for a lot of
you will be the inclusion of that type
seaport in addition to your standard USB
3 and that type C definitely seems to be
a make-or-break feature for some
consumers these days and at the very
least it's a great consideration by
Rajan Tech for some future proofing both
the affiant and the affine Evo support
up to a 2 slot graphics card with a
length of three hundred and thirty
millimeters and in both cases they were
showing off what looks like a GTX 1080s
groups which is by no means a small card
of course though being pushed so close
to the side panel it does have its
implications when it comes to cooling so
a blow style card may be recommended now
the tempered glass side panels are
pretty much entirely flush with the rest
of the case which means that if you are
going to be using them airflow is going
to be pretty tight at least any smaller
affiant as I said before though you can
mount to 120 millimeter fans at the top
and run those in exhaust and that could
potentially give you some pretty good
results both also support a full ATX
power supply which I thought was pretty
cool and is that ATX yes cool eight-six
what about the other one is that only
SFX or but but it is
for storage that looks like this support
for two two and a half inch drives as
written on the product briefing for both
the affine and affine evo and those
slots will be likely towards the front
of the case now stepping up to the
affiant evo this case is exactly the
same length and width as the regular
affiant but adds 70 millimeters in
height to allow for a 240 millimeter
radiator this is absolutely awesome and
especially in a relatively affordable
package this way you could run a
power-hungry CPU like a risin 720 700 or
an i7 8700 k and cooling that should be
no issue with a 240 millimeter radiator
and a pair of good fans with your fine
Eva though you can also fit 120
millimeter fan in the bottom of the case
allowing for direct cooling over the
motherboard VRMs since the motherboard
is in an upside-down configuration so
vrm cooling is always a consideration
and topic of discussion in these small
cases which usually relies on passive
airflow but if you're running a
power-hungry system that needs to be
compact then the affiant evo could just
be what you're after and whether this
direct vrm cooling was on accident or on
purpose well it's definitely great to
see so these are two cases that I was
very pleased to see on the show floor
this afternoon and I know a few of you
guys will appreciate them as well
official release date is unconfirmed at
this point but it does look like we
could see these two cases heating the
shelves quite soon I'd love to know what
you guys think of these two so drop your
comments down below as always guys a
huge thanks for watching and I'll see
you all in the next one
